http://www.recoilmag.com/news/iraqs_untold_success_1007.html
 
 
Iraq's untold three-block success story
 Ghizlayat, Iraq - Frustrated by an inability to demonstrate lasting stability in Iraq, U.S. officials have settled on highlighting the army's impressive achievements in a three-block area north of Baghdad.
 
 While most of the village of Ghizlayat has lived without running water or electricity since the U.S. invasion in 2003, a section of Ghizlayat's southwest corner - excluding the strife-torn area surrounding its police station - has been "relatively livable for nearly a month now," according to Rear Admiral Mark Fox, a U.S. military spokesman.

 
 
Abu Khalifa, who lives in the neighborhood with his wife and two children, said he feels fortunate to live in the southwest corner of Ghizlayat.
 
 "It is good. Before, you could not walk three blocks without fearing for your life. Now you can. But not four," he said. "We have water and sometimes electricity. It is good. I am happy to be alive. Also, I know that none of my family members will be killed while walking these blocks. They were all killed during the invasion."

 
 
Fox noted the absence of Sunni-Shiite tension in the village, attributing the success to aggressive outreach to tribal sheiks, coordinated efforts to open communication and promote understanding, and the 2005 massacre that killed much of the Shiite minority.
 
 "There are more than enough armchair quarterbacks to tell you that these people won't work for a unified nation, but for about two years that's just what's happened here," said Fox. "If you want to see dysfunctional, look at Tuz Khormato. Or Jican. Or any area other than these three blocks."
[sarcasm]Cherry picking? Gasp! The administration wouldn't do that![/sarcasm]

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Progress in Iraq
